segment.source: This example assumes that you have lightweight code you can run in the background to enhance your app while the device is plugged in.
segment.target: This example assumes that you have lightweight code you can run in the background to enhance your app while the device is plugged in.

segment.source: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the maintenance task will run once or continue to run periodically.
segment.target: The second parameter, OneShot, specifies whether the maintenance task will run once or continue to run periodically.

segment.source: If OneShot is set to true, the first parameter (FreshnessTime) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.
segment.target: If OneShot is set to true, the first parameter (FreshnessTime) specifies the number of minutes to wait before scheduling the background task.

segment.source: If OneShot is set to false, FreshnessTime specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.
segment.target: If OneShot is set to false, FreshnessTime specifies the frequency by which the background task will run.

segment.source: Note If FreshnessTime is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.
segment.target: Note If FreshnessTime is set to less than 15 minutes, an exception is thrown when attempting to register the background task.

segment.source: A condition prevents your background task from running until the condition is met - for more information, see Set conditions for running a background task

segment.source: Note For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.
segment.target: Note For all device families except desktop, if the device becomes low on memory, background tasks may be terminated.

segment.source: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.
segment.target: If an out of memory exception is not surfaced, or the app does not handle it, then the background task will be terminated without warning and without raising the OnCanceled event.

segment.source: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.
segment.target: This helps to ensure the user experience of the app in the foreground.

segment.source: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.
segment.target: Your background task should be designed to handle this scenario.

segment.source: Note Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.
segment.target: Note Universal Windows apps must call RequestAccessAsync before registering any of the background trigger types.

segment.source: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.
segment.target: To ensure that your Universal Windows app continues to run properly after you release an update, you must call RemoveAccess and then call RequestAccessAsync when your app launches after being updated.

segment.source: Note Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.
segment.target: Note Background task registration parameters are validated at the time of registration.

segment.source: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.
segment.target: An error is returned if any of the registration parameters are invalid.

segment.source: Ensure that your app gracefully handles scenarios where background task registration fails - if instead your app depends on having a valid registration object after attempting to register a task, it may crash.
